current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prevent the creation of duplicative and
		  overlapping Federal programs.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Preventing Duplicative and Overlapping
			 Government Programs Resolution

text.#text: This resolution may be cited as the

Paragraph 11 of
			 rule XXVI of the Standing Rules of the Senate is amended—

by redesignating
			 subparagraph (c) and subparagraph (d); and

by inserting
			 after subparagraph (b) the following:

The report
				accompanying each bill or joint resolution of a public character reported by
				any committee (including the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to determine if the bill or joint resolution
				creates any new Federal program, office, or initiative that would duplicate or
				overlap any existing Federal program, office, or initiative with similar
				mission, purpose, goals, or activities along with a listing of all of the
				overlapping or duplicative Federal program or programs, office or offices, or
				initiative or initiatives; and

text.#text:
an explanation
				provided by the committee as to why the creation of each new program, office,
				or initiative is necessary if a similar program or programs, office or offices,
				or initiative or initiatives already
				exist.

Rule XVII of the Standing Rules of the
			 Senate is amended by inserting at the end thereof the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to proceed to any bill or joint resolution unless the committee of
				jurisdiction has prepared and posted on the committee website an overlapping
				and duplicative programs analysis and explanation for the bill or joint
				resolution as described in subparagraph (b) prior to proceeding.

text.#text:
It shall not be in order in
				the

The analysis and
				explanation required by this subparagraph shall contain—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to determine if the bill or joint resolution
				creates any new Federal program, office, or initiative that would duplicate or
				overlap any existing Federal program, office, or initiative with similar
				mission, purpose, goals, or activities along with a listing of all of the
				overlapping or duplicative Federal program or programs, office or offices, or
				initiative or initiatives; and

text.#text:
an explanation
				provided by the committee as to why the creation of each new program, office,
				or initiative is necessary if a similar program or programs, office or offices,
				or initiative or initiatives already exist.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
upon their certification that such waiver is necessary as a
				result of—

text.#text:
This paragraph
				may be waived by joint agreement of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
facilities or to the availability of the Internet;
				or

text.#text:
an emergency as
				determined by the
				leaders.
